inn1.comm: presents one just back of a length on middle and off, Danushka gets up as tall as he can to gently knock it into the covers

"yes, yes, yes," says Danuskha but be can't convince his senior partner for a single. Dilshan is sprightly even at 39, but with McCullum coming in from mid-off, discretion is the better part of valour.
just back of a good length and outside off, no shot offered
another teaser outside off, but since it is not all that full, the batsman gets a nice sighter and leaves it
explores a fuller length outside off, eased to point
good length ball on off stump, defended in front of the wicket
provides a nice push to mid-off

fullish on middle, with just a little shape away. Dilshan covers it with a straight bat. Oh, but we won't be seeing that anymore. The back of the bat seems to have cracked and Dilshan asks for a replacement
back of a length and outside off, opens the face of the bat and guides to point
this time he gets the ball to dart back into the right-hander, who is not quite ready for it. Late to adjust to it as he tries to flick off the front foot. Beaten, and struck high on the back leg
nudged away towards square leg, the indipper again, and again the shot was not too convincing
gets some healthy bounce, but he is a touch too straight. Dilshan goes for the leg glance, but only gets a smidge of the trouser on it. Four leg byes
stands up tall and punches the short of a length delivery through the covers. Santner was the man prowling that area, and he may have got a bad bounce to let the ball right through him
driven down the ground, and although he did look to play authoritatively, the shot has been mistimed. Henry gets down to it in time to stop any runs
that's brilliant! That's pure instinct! This is a pretty decent delivery - full on off stump - but Dilshan drags it away to the square leg boundary

advances on the bowler, no turning back for Dilshan! The bowler digs it in shorter and it has been whipped away towards the long leg boundary. Henry is the man hunting it down, puts in a big dive but the ball still rolls on towards the advertising triangles. So Henry has to put in a second dive, and just about keeps it inside
short of a good length again, blocked into the off side
banged quite hard into the middle of the deck, Danushka goes for a pull but hasn't put everything behind it. A little slow on it, perhaps
gorgeous hit, as they are when they go down the ground! Saw the ball full on off stump and backed himself.
lines up a short ball quickly enough and heaves it to short midwicket. A few yards either side and that would have been four too
outside edge, as he repeats an on the up drive. The target area was mid-off, but it ends up lost at deep third man
another inswinger from Henry, full and fast to have Dilshan falling over at the crease. Would have slid down leg though

oh my word! He jumped down the pitch, but then decided he didn't want play. That's credit to Henry for bowling the ball shorter, and getting it to zip back into the batsman. Takes the face of the bat even as Dilshan tries to hide it behind his body and it ends up caught at first slip!
pats it into the covers
lovely little intro. Hi, I'm going to hit the deck, pin you on the back foot and rip the ball past the outside edge. Have fun.
gets the ball to hit the splice of the bat, with Danushka stood firmly deep in his crease. Pushed towards point
back of a length on off stump, guided towards point again
the sticker of the bat is getting some good coverage here on the replays. McClenaghan bangs it in and gets it to rise towards the ribs. Nudged to the left of the slips

launched down the ground! The first sign of the ball being full and Danushka gives it the big golf swing. Solid front foot stride, booming intent, and he has got just enough on it to soar over Bracewell at mid-on and beat his dive on the boundary too
full on middle, Danushka works it towards midwicket
massive effort at point from Guptill! Flew to his left, and parries it with one hand to his colleage at cover. Wonderfully timed, and well controlled dab from Thirimanne ends up with only one
rapid! That's a 140 kph bouncer! Danushka does well by dropping his wrists and swaying away from the line. Right over off stump, it was too

he is always on the lookout for the chip over the infield. A fuller length helps and he has a very good eye, it seems. Picks it up early and trusts his power. The bat turns in his hand, but it still had enough on it to beat McCullum running back from mid-off
defended into the off side
fuller delivery on off stump, pushed into the covers
that time he is unable to work the drive. Henry held it back just enough that it can kiss the pitch and zip past the outside edge of the bat, and not be crunched by the middle
gets it to duck back into the left-hander, and Thirimanne, expecting the outsswinger, is very late on it. Gets only an inside edge onto his body
just back of a good length and on a fourth stump line, defended

slashed high, but not long enough! Thirimanne is appalled at giving it away so easily. The ball was short, it had enough width too. Out came the upper cut, which just drops down the throat of Henry at deep third man
short of a length on leg stump, whipped away behind square leg to get off the mark
fuller delivery on off stump, driven to mid-on

beautiful bowling from Henry. Starts the awayswinger on middle and leg and gets some assistance off the deck as well. Danushka presses forward with hard hands and gets an edge. Falls short of third slip though. Latham did his best, diving low to his right

what a ripper! Santner threw himself to his left at cover, thuds into the lush green Hagley Oval outfield and comes up with a superb catch. Had his eyes on the prize all the way. It was a fuller ball that tempted the batsman on the drive again. Danushka has not been very keen to keep the ball down and this time Santner's brilliance - he took it with both hands - makes him pay
back of a length and tucking him up, picked away to long leg
just back of a good length on off stump, defended. And Chandimal's space is invaded by the three slips, and the point fielder rushing forward
full and tailing in on off stump, pushed to mid-on

direct hit? No and Chandimal can heave a sigh of relief after having to scramble a single. Both batsmen hesitated after a shortish delivery was nudged into the midwicket region. Had they gone straight away, it would have been easy. And once Henry saw the indecision, he raced forward to the ball, whipped around and send a bullet throw too. Just didn't hit the target
shortish, but it's misdirected on leg stump, easily worked to long leg
banged into the middle of the deck at 134 kph, Mathews who was trying to push forward is forced to take evasive action

ooooh, Baz throws himself at the ball on the boundary edge and thuds into the advertising hoardings. Poor delivery, half-volley on leg stump, whipped away to deep square leg. McCullum hunted after the ball like it had wronged him, put in the dive, flicked the ball inside and saves a run. But all that effort has meant he has to go off the field to tend to himself. I think it is an issue with his right hand.
stands up tall and slams a back of a length delivery off the front foot through point
the captain had gone trekking down the pitch, but Chandimal yells "NOOOOOO." Boy, that definitely helped. Defence into the cover region ends up as a dot
good length ball around the off stump, blocked
jumps back in his crease, absorbs all the pace on this back of a length ball on off stump and exploits the gap at midiwcket
presents the full face to a good length ball on off stump. Lovely strong stride forward as well. Chandimal looking intense.
drilled back down the ground as he eases into a fuller ball, cannot get it past the bowler though
"No, nooooo!" yells Chandimal again as Mathews charges down for a quick single. No such thing there as the fielder at mid-on races in so quickly
width on offer and Chandimal laces the ball away, but he forgets to pick the gap at cover. Missed opportunity there
good length ball on off stump, defended
carefully blunted into the covers, as he gets back in his crease for the short of a length ball across him

this time its Chandimal's turn to see a single that wasn't there. Mathews turned leg stump into a shiny target as he moved across, McClenaghan went for it with a good length ball on leg stump. Thigh pad gets in the way, and Mathews took a couple of steps down as if he wanted the single but square leg was quick
fuller and wider outside off, Mathews caresses it down the ground. That's all batsmen need to do. Time the ball and pick the gap instead of losing your head with quick singles
good length ball on off stump, defended
tickled around the corner as he gets inside the line of a short ball on middle and leg
fuller ball outside off, sweetly hit to cover

su-weeet! I like Mathews' tactics today. Bracewell is not quite the hit the deck bowler, so he is batting outside his crease. This is an even-paced pitch so he is making the ball come onto the bat even more, and it helps when the bowler bowls straight. Flicked away through wide mid-on
looks for that gap again, but he hits mid-on
back of a length, darts back into the batsman, who is struck just on top of his pads. Lack of footwork there

jags the ball back and again Mathews is struck on the thigh again. Bracwell has adjusted his line and is started wider of off stump. Mathews is cut in half by the movement back into him, he was only offering an uncertain little waft
fuller delivery outside off and Mathews throws his bat at it despite being quite stagnant at the crease. Figures I praise him and he goes all lead-footed on me. Beaten on the inside edge again
good length, outside off, covers the line nicely this time and defends
tossed up on off stump, driven to mid-off
a touch short and immediately Chandimal is waiting on the back foot and cuts to deep point
goes back against a flatter ball and clips it to deep square leg
gets to the pitch of a loopy one outside off and runs with the shot, which helps him beat the throw
shortish, so the batsman can stay back, wait set himself up and punch it down to long-on
held it back a touch there, but Chandimal delays his shot just enough to slice it to deep point
good length ball outside off, defended into the covers
that's a reminder that Dougie can get it buzzing around the ears too. Digs it in and Chandimal, who was originally looking to pull realises it is a bit too high and pulls out of his shot
back of a length on off stump, punched to mid-off

is he in line? Yes. Does he have an inside edge? It appears not. Chandimal walked down to have a chat with his captain, and Mathews sends him on his way just as the umpire did. Bracewell's inswingers have been on the mark, this one began outside off stump, tempting the batsman into thinking it could be driven through the off side. So forward and across came Chandimal and got trapped. His bat was outside the line and couldn't find a way back in time, his front leg was right in line and he was struck on the knee roll
back of a length on off stump, defended
beauty again! He gets it to kick off the pitch and seam away as well. And Siriwardana is new to the crease, so he gets stuck in it. The hands, indicating his nerves, push at the ball and he is beaten
moves right across outside off and blocks the short ball into the covers
gets inside the line of a short ball and clips it to long leg. That back and across movement is very noticeable
gets up to try and get on top of a short ball just outside off, still doesn't succeed in looking in control. Guided to third man nonetheless
back of a length and just outside off, defused by his feet

eeesh! Mathews was in all sorts of trouble there. With him moving back and across, his ribs are right in the line of fire when the bowler goes for a bouncer on middle. Fends it away, gets a glove towards fine leg

another bouncer right over middle, another instance of Mathews looking absolutely awkward after moving across outside off. And to make it worse, he has gloved this behind. The Sri Lanka captain was looking to perhaps nudge it around the corner, but there was just a bit more bounce than he liked
good riposte! And he does look like a player who has a lot of shots when the ball is in his half of the pitch. Gets forward and drags one from off stump over mid-on. Very elegant, even slogging
that time he has no answer to the fuller length, because it was tagged with a little bit of awayswing. Had to play, soundly beaten

dug in short, nice and tight on off stump too. New Zealand have been very accurate whenever they have gone for the short one. Siriwardana committed to pulling, and then had second thoughts. But that time the ball thudded into the face of the bat - he did not drop his wrists quick enough - and the ball just lobbed over midiwcket
back of a length on off stump, defended
fuller delivery on off stump, kept out
sweetly timed, it's Kapugedera who gets to enjoy a good batting pitch a little earlier than he might have expected. Gets in line to the fuller ball and simply drilled it down the ground
goes for the short one at 132 clicks, right over off stump. Siriwardana lets it go
that time he takes the short ball on, and did so quite well. Got on top of the bounce and rolled his wrists to keep it down and in front of square
a very loopy old bouncer on middle and off, sails over the ducking left-hander, has been called as a wide
lifter outside off, and Siriwardana is unequal to the challenge. Can't really fault him for that, just doff your hat to the bowler and move on
that time its a little wider, and a little shorter. Went for the right shot, got back, got tall and looked to punch it through the covers. Couldn't touch it
good length ball on off stump, defended
no-ball called for the height. He had already bowled a couple of bouncers in this over, went for a third and though it was a pretty good one - right over middle and leg - he will be penalised
backs away, gets under a back of a length ball and launches the free hit to the long-off boundary. Remember, any no ball now becomes a free hit now
back of a length on and around off stump, defended
138 kph, good length ball met with a defensive push to point
leans into a drive to the left of mid-off having picked up a fuller ball which had some width. Should have done more with that

that's well done! Does not shy away from the short ball, despite it having caused so much problems. Swivelled on his back foot and pulls it behind square leg. The trick here was he got on top of the bounce
smeared through extra cover. Kapugedera's timing has been very pleasing to watch. Saw the ball overpitched, and credit to him for being limber enough to stride forward despite the bouncer last ball
whipped away to deep backward square leg with ease.
short ball, tucking him up, clipped through midwicket

picks out point like a sharpshooter. Sri Lanka continue to sink, and its the short ball that's continuing to haunt them. Siriwardana is up on his tippy-toes and he crunches the ball away, but forgets about placement. A few yards either side and he would have beaten Nicholls and got a boundary
fuller ball on off stump, defended
short of a length, safely defused

absolute shocker! Kula and Kapu were at the same end, preparing to shake hands, and New Zealand were able to throw to the wrong end, recover and then hit the target at the right one. Back of a length ball was eased towards point, and Kula took a few steps down. Kapu responded and did not look back. Kalu did though, because Guptill at point moved quickly to his right to cut the angle. The throw misses the target at the batsman's end, but Nicholls backs up nicely at midiwcket and relays the ball to a man waiting at the bowler's end. There really was no single there.
good length ball on off stump, defended
banged in short on middle and off, Senanayake looks quite awkward fending it away

inside edge onto the stumps, New Zealand's pacemen are slicing through Sri Lanka. Henry comes on, bowls a good length just outside off. The batsman helps him by providing a bit of wood to make sure the ball hits off
fuller ball, drilled through the covers. This has been a strange little show from Sri Lanka. Some crisp strokes, amid the carnage
bouncer outside off, sways away from the line
back of a length on off stump, defended
strikes the batsman on the thigh pad as he beats Chameera for pace, and a little cut back in as well
good length ball on off stump, defended
Beautiful. Picked up a length ball and packs it away to the long-off boundary. Lovely little extension of defence, to lob mid-off. see what I mean? Crisp shots and crazy chaos
banged in short, as a fast bowler does when the tailender gets the best of him, Chameera balls himself under it
fuller ball outside off, Chameera goes for the booming drive and is beaten because he swings his bat inside the line. Looked quite pretty though
back of a length and outside off, pushed into the covers
oh, that's nice. Chameera stays in line to a quick, short ball and blocks into the covers. No mug, this lad

good length ball on middle and off, gets some shape away late as well. But Chameera does well to block and keep his hands soft. Gets and outside edge, which dribbles past the cordon. Yes, there have been two, or three slips throughout the innings
banged in short and outside off, shoulders arms

dropped by a driving first slip! Lovely delivery in the off stump channel from Henry, and the lead-footed batsman pokes as if he was seduced by his fellow fast bowler's discipline and decided to nick off. If only Ross Taylor had moved quick enough
good length ball on middle and off, defended
starts off with one that goes on with the arm, and drags it short too. Kula misses out as he goes for the pull
not that time. Picks up the half-tracker and hammered a pull to deep square leg
stays back and flicks the flatter ball to deep backward square leg

right in front. Kula plays for the turn, but Sodhi rarely gets the ball to move sideways. I think he is struck in line around off stump, and it was low enough for him to be lbw. But Kula goes for a review. No bat involved, which umpire Gough checks with both Hot Spot and Snicko. But ball-tracking saves Kula - has been struck outside the line. Well well well, that is certainly one heck of a review
stump to stump bowling, but he does not dare flight the ball for some reason. Clipped into the vacant midwicket region

wild appeal from the keeper and the bowler, but I think there was daylight between bat and ball. Someone from the NZ cordon says, "I heard something," so stand-in captain Taylor goes for the review. This was a good length ball that does turn after pitching. Chameera was only half-forward as he goes to block. Hot Spot shows a mark on the edge and he has to go off. Another heck of review.
sizes up the short ball, which doesn't have all that much pace, but certainly enough room to be swatted away to the midwicket boundary
another short one, but this one is only helped away towards the open space at deep midwicket.
good length ball on off stump, eased between point and cover. Misfield there allows Vandersay to get off the mark in ODI cricket
backs away and wallops a short of a length ball over the bowler's head! That is some shot. That is cricket's version of viva la resistance.
another short ball on middle and leg, Kula gets inside the line and gloves it down to the keeper
saw the batsman backing away and went for a bouncer that follows the batsman, but Kula manages to pull it and gets just enough glove to get it past the keeper and into the fine leg boundary
read the turn off the pitch and then plays the latest of late cuts, gets it past the first slip and then backward point for a couple
tossed up on off stump, pushed to cover
went for a big heave ho, but Sodhi was able to get the googly to dip on off stump. Inside edge to midwicket
likes the flight on this one and slog sweeps it to the deep midwicket. No. 8 becomes the highest scorer of the innings
flighted outside off, defended
googly, sliding down leg. Vandersay went back, read it off the pitch but could not catch up with it
"catch," says the keeper and though three men ran after it, Vandersay's streaking little outside edge lobs over cover
back of a length but too far outside off to sucker the batsman into playing
good length ball outside off, pushed into the covers
short of a length and outside off, left well enough alone
gets behind a back of a length ball on off stump
looks for the slog when he sees the length ball outside off, inside edges it to mid-on
back of a length and outside off, pushed into the covers
tossed up on off stump, defended
lazy elegance, Kula where have you been for so long? Saw the loopy leggie just outside off and heaves it to the man at deep midwicket
flighted outside off, laced through the gap in the covers. Gee, this final-wicket partnership may end up being the best for Sri Lanka today
gets some kick off the good length ball on leg stump, blunted
driven into cover as he prods forwrard to the pitch
flighted on off stump, kept out
back of a length and outside off, patted into the covers
fuller ball outside off, driven to mid-off
stays back and guides the short ball into the covers

backs away and smashes a length ball right into the hands at short cover. Smart grab that from Latham, as he jumps up and takes it high over his head. That's all Sri Lanka have for you. The umpires check the front foot, he's fine. He's got another four-for.

inn2.comm: chance, dropped and the chaos continues. Chameera starts off from around the wicket and digs the ball in short. He has the field for it and Guptill keeps them in play as he pulls feebly. Rushed by the pace, the ball ends up at leg gully. Siriwardana had to dive to his right, got two hands to it, and then it spilled out and went to the boundary
another short ball, pulled strongly between leg gully and short square leg
good call to take on the short ball, that seems to be the ploy for Sri Lanka and Latham does his best to upset that with a sweet little upper cut over point
banged in but the radar is all wonky, goes way down the leg side
back of a length and sliding down leg again, goes for the flick and misses out
gets up off his toes to defend a short ball from around the wicket
another one testing the hardness of the middle of this deck, Latham tucks it past the diving leg gully
backs away to give himself some room, seeing as Chameera stays around the stumps to the right-hander too. He is still cramped and pats the short ball to mid-off

he does not have the pace to bowl short and Guptill seemed to be waiting for it in that knowledge. Took a couple of steps down the track and launches it into the fans way beyond long-on. Didn't even look up, what a boss.
another screamer! Just hitting through the line, and that line was way outside off too. Guptill laces it past point off the front foot
full and just outside off, Guptill takes this on too. Goes for a slash over mid-off, but the outside edge takes it to the third man boundary

walks across outside off and is struck low on the pad. Good, concerted appeal from Kula and I think he was in with a shout for lbw. Mathews goes for a review, very very late. The 15 second period had passed, but it seems like Sri Lanka have persuaded the on-field umps to still go for it. Fuller ball on middle and leg, Guptill went for an manufactured, agricultural heave and is safe because the ball was sliding down leg
back of a length and outside off, shoulders arms
lovely line on around fourth stump, and the orthodox Latham steps forward to it and leaves it
backs away, and this time he creates the width he wants with Chameera deciding to go around the wicket. Gets under this one just back of a length and on leg stump, and launches it over long-off
dug in short, on and around off stump, but Guptill had again jumped outside leg and slashed it over third man. This is some hitting, and each one is making Sri Lanka's batsmen look so sheepish
banged in, down leg, Guptill leaves

carts it over the infield and this has gone all the way as well! The crowd at point is well pleased. New Zealand are nearing 50 in the third over! Guptill is 38 off 10! Another win for him backing away and banishing a short ball

flat batted down the ground! He is 42 off 11, looking for the World and New Zealand record for fastest fifty. De Villiers got there in 16 balls, McCullum in 18 balls. This ball, from Chameera was over the wicket, and shortish. Slammed away
46 from 12! He is well on  course to beat de Villiers!. This one was short too, he had moved outside leg again and heaves it past mid-on. Not the most perfectly timed stroke, but it'll do
slower ball! How very very well done by the youngster! Saw the batsman making room, and took all the pace off it by bowling the back of the hander. Guptill applauds Chameera, "well bowled"
picked away through midwicket
lands a yorker on off stump and Guptill can only find a single to long-on. He needs three runs off the next ball to claim the world record
good length ball on off stump, defended
banged in short, way too short, Latham leaves outside off
another bouncer that trails a path too high over Latham's head. Latham was coming down the pitch, so that was the bowler trying to one-up his enemy. Ends up failing
back of a length and cutting back into him. Latham weathers a rather optimistic lbw appeal, and finds a single at cover
another pin point yorker on the base of middle and off, Guptill only inside edges into the midiwcket region and has to settle for a single.
meets the length ball on middle and clips it sweetly to midwicket
short and wide, Guptill was camped on leg stump, just did not move his feet and if only he had, he could have pasted that ball over the off side. As it is, he toe ends it to cover
short again and this time Latham, by virtue of quick footwork to exploit the depth of the crease, pulls to deep square leg boundary
tossed up on middle, defended
a touch short and wide, Latham cuts it behind point and the placement is good enough to get three

nudged into the midwicket region to record the fastest ODI fifty by a New Zealander. Went off like a freight train against the short and length balls. Was given the luxury to do so by the small total. Very McCullum like, and it was his record that Guptill has taken over
pushed into the mid-on region

first ball in ODI cricket is a long hop, which Guptill muscles over the short fine leg. Pitching middle and leg, going on with the arm because there is not as much spin. Was close to the diving man at 45 degrees, but it was a very hard chance
gee, they are going to finish this before lunch! Picks up a length ball and pastes it into the grass banks beyond long-on. That's a 107 m monster
maybe he thought the off side boundary was feeling left out. Plants the front leg outside leg stump and plants the ball over the ropes at long-off
one-bounce four as he meets the short ball on middle stump and flat bats it down the ground. Sri Lanka continue to unravel, Guptill is simply relishing in their misery
fired in quick on middle and leg to cramp him up, defended
that time it was tossed up and Guptill winds up and smears it over the cover boundary. Once he knows he can get under the ball, he is never taking second thoughts. Just clean hitting
nudged behind square leg, looks like Latham is the perfect foil for Guptill who is nearing a hundred, when the target itself is 118
pushed down to mid-on
whoa! Picks the carrom ball from the front of the hand, waits for it to pitch and turn and offer him the width he wants. Then it is crisply cut behind point
that time he had to make room for himself, which he has been doing so easily. Slapped through cover. Now he is looking for the fastest 100 in ODI cricket! That was in 31 balls by AB
tossed up on off stump pushed to long-off to run the chances of a fastest ODI century today. Well, a solo record anyway
goes back and whips it to deep square leg
flights on off stump, driven sweetly to long-off
slog sweep into the grass banks! That smile on Guppy's face keeps getting bigger and bigger, almost like his sixes. Just takes a full ball on middle and muscles
flatter length ball on off stump, slapped away to long-off
pushed through on leg stump, Latham looks for a tickle but is hit on the thigh pad.
blocks the tossed up ball on off stump
held that back on off stump to keep Latham to a block
punches through the covers to take a single. Scores are level! And this match is only in 35 overs
there we go, easy as that. Gentle little clip into the leg side to help New Zealand wrap up a 2-0 lead in the series before the lunch break in the second ODI
